S0127.Q1. WHAT IS YOUR ARMY RANK OR GRAD?  1. PRIVATE 2. PRIVATE FIRST CLASS 3. TECHNICIAN 5TH GRADE OR CORPORAL 4. TECHNICIAN 4TH GRADE OR SERGEANT 5. TECHNICIAN 3RD GRADE OR STAFF SERGEANT 6. TECHNICAL SERGEANT 7. MASTER SERGEANT OR FIRST SERGEANT 8. OTHER 0. NO ANSWER
S0127.Q2. HOW OLD WERE YOU ON YOUR LAST BIRTHDA?  01. 18 YEARS OR LESS 02. 19 YEARS 03. 20 04. 21 05. 22 06. 23 07. 24 08. 25 09. 26-29 YEARS 10. 30-34 YEARS 11. 35 YEARS AND OVER 00. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q3. HOW FAR DID YOU GO IN SCHOO?  1. LESS THAN 6TH GRADE 2. FINISHED 6TH GRADE 3. FINISHED 7TH GRADE 4. FINISHED 8TH GRADE 5. SOME HIGH SCHOOL BUT DID NOT FINISH 6. GRADUATED FROM HIGH SCHOOL 7. SOME COLLEGE BUT DID NOT FINISH 8. GRADUATED FROM COLLEGE 0. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q4. IN WHAT STATE OF THE UNITED STATES DID YOU SPEND MOST OF THE LAST FIVE YEARS OF YOUR CIVILIAN LIFE BEFORE YOU CAME INTO THE ARM? E. REGION:  01. NEW ENGLAND 02. MIDDLE ATLANTIC 03. EAST NORTH CENTRAL 04. WEST NORTH CENTRAL 05. SOUTH ATLANTIC 06. EAST SOUTH CENTRAL 07. WEST SOUTH CENTRAL 08. MOUNTAIN 09. PACIFIC 10. FOREIGN, NOT U.S. 00. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q5. WHERE WERE YOU LIVING MOST OF THE LAST FIVE YEARS OF YOUR CIVILIAN LIFE BEFORE YOU CAME INTO THE ARM?  1. ON A FARM OR IN THE COUNTRY 2. IN A SMALL TOWN (FEWER THAN 2,500 PEOPLE) 3. IN A TOWN (WITH BETWEEN 2,500 AND 25,000 PEOPLE) 4. IN A CITY (BETWEEN 25,000 AND 100,000 PEOPLE) 5. IN A LARGE CITY (MORE THAN 100,000 PEOPLE) 6. NO ANSWER 0. NO CODE OR NO DATA X. QUESTIONS 6 AND 7 TO BE CODED TOGETHER.

S0127.Q6. ARE YOU SINGLE, MARRIED, DIVORCED OR SEPARATED, OR WIDOWE? F. IF MARRIED:  Q.7. WERE YOU MARRIED BEFORE OR AFTER ENTERING THE ARM?  1. SINGLE 2. DIVORCED OR SEPARATED 3. WIDOWED 4. MARRIED BEFORE ENTERING THE ARMY 5. MARRIED AFTER ENTERING THE ARMY 6. MARRIED IN Q.6, NO ANSWER IN Q.7 0. NO ANSWER
S0127.Q8. HOW MANY CHILDREN DO YOU HAV?  1. I'M NOT MARRIED 2. HAVE NO CHILDREN 3. HAVE ONE CHILD 4. HAVE TWO CHILDREN 5. HAVE THREE OR MORE CHILDREN 0. NO ANSWER
S0127.Q9. HOW DID YOU COME INTO THE ARM?  1. I WAS DRAFTED 2. I VOLUNTEERED 3. I WAS IN THE NATIONAL GUARD 0. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q10. HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN IN THE ARM? E. IF YOU HAVE BEEN IN THE ARMY BEFORE, THEN WERE OUT FOR A WHILE, JUST CHECK THE LENGTH OF TIME SINCE YOU ENTERED THIS LAST TIME. IF YOU WERE IN THE NATIONAL GUARD, CHECK THE LENGTH OF TIME SINCE YOUR OUTFIT CAME INTO THE ARMY.  1. 6 MONTHS OR LESS 2. OVER 6 MONTHS UP TO 9 MONTHS 3. OVER 9 MONTHS UP TO ONE YEAR 4. OVER 1 YEAR UP TO 2 YEARS 5. OVER 2 YEARS UP TO 3 YEARS 6. OVER 3 YEARS 0. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q11. HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN IN THE CHINA-BURMA-INDIA THEATE?  1. 3 MONTH OR LESS 2. OVER 3 MONTHS UP TO 6 MONTHS 3. OVER 6 MONTHS UP TO 9 MONTHS 4. OVER 9 MONTHS UP TO 1 YEAR 5. OVER 1 YEAR UP TO 18 MONTHS 6. OVER 18 MONTHS 0. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q12. HOW LONG HAVE YOU BEEN STATIONED AT THIS PARTICULAR PLAC?  1. 3 MONTHS OR LESS 2. OVER 3 MONTHS UP TO 6 MONTHS 3. OVER 6 MONTHS UP TO 9 MONTHS 4. OVER 9 MONTHS UP TO 1 YEAR 5. OVER 1 YEAR 0. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q13. WHAT BRANCH OF THE ARMY ARE YOU IN NO?  1. ENGINEERS, COAST ARTILLERY OR ANTI-AIRCRAFT 2. FIELD ARTILLERY OR AIR CORPS 3. QUARTERMASTER CORPS OR TRANSPORTATION CORPS 4. INFANTRY OR ORDNANCE DEPARTMENT 5. MEDICAL DEPARTMENT OR CHEMICAL WARFARE SERVICE 6. ARMORED FORCE OR MILITARY POLICE 7. SIGNAL CORPS OR D.E.M.L. 8. FINANCE DEPARTMENT OR OTHER
S0127.Q14. DO YOU FEEL PROUD OF YOUR COMPANY (BATTERY, SQUADRON, TROOP)*  1. YES, VERY PROUD 2. YES, FAIRLY PROUD 3. NO, NOT PROUD 4. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q15. HOW MANY OF THE OFFICERS IN YOUR COMPANY (BATTERY, SQUADRON, TROOP) ARE THE KIND YOU WOULD WANT TO SERVE UNDER IN COMBA?  1. ALL OF THEM ARE 2. MOST OF THEM ARE 3. ABOUT HALF OF THEM ARE 4. FEW OF THEM ARE 5. NONE OF THEM ARE 0. NO ANSWER
S0127.Q16. HOW MANY OF YOUR OFFICERS TAKE A PERSONAL INTEREST IN THEIR ME?  1. ALL OF THEM DO 2. MOST OF THEM DO 3. ABOUT HALF OF THEM DO 4. FEW OF THEM DO 5. NONE OF THEM DO 0. NO ANSWER
S0127.Q17. HOW DO YOU THINK YOUR COMPANY WOULD SHOW UP UNDER COMBAT CONDITION?  1. VERY WELL 2. FAIRLY WELL 3. NOT SO WELL 4. POORLY 5. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q18. CONSIDERING EVERYTHING, INCLUDING THE DIFFICULTIES, HOW WELL WOULD YOU SAY YOUR OUTFIT IS DOING THE JOB WHICH IT IS SUPPOSED TO D?  1. VERY WELL 2. FAIRLY WELL 3. NOT SO WELL 4. POORLY 5. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q19. DO YOU THINK THE EQUIPMENT OF THE AMERICAN ARMY IS BETTER OR WORSE THAN THE EQUIPMENT OF THE JAPANESE ARM?  1. ALL OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS BETTER 2. MOST OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS BETTER 3. OUR EQUIPMENT IS ABOUT THE SAME QUALITY AS THAT OF THE JAPANESE ARMY 4. MOST OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS WORSE 5. ALL OF OUR EQUIPMENT IS WORSE 6. DON'T KNOW 0. NO ANSWER X. QUESTION 20 NOT CODED.

S0127.Q25. IF YOU COULD TAKE THE COURSES OR SCHOOL SUBJECTS YOU LISTED IN QUESTIONS 21 AND 24 ABOVE, WHILE YOU ARE IN THE ARMY, WOULD YOU BE WILLING TO SPEND A PART OF YOUR OFF- DUTY FREE TIME STUDYING THE?  1. YES, I WOULD SPEND PART OF MY OFF-DUTY FREE TIME STUDYING 2. NO, I WOULD NOT BE WILLING TO SPEND ANY OFF-DUTY FREE TIME STUDYING 3. DID NOT LIST ANY COURSES IN EITHER QUESTION 21 OR QUESTION 24 0. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q26. IF YOU WERE GOING TO TAKE SOME COURSES DURING YOUR FREE TIME WHILE YOU ARE IN THE ARMY, WHICH WOULD YOU LIKE BETTER: LESSONS SENT TO YOU BY MAIL; OR CLASSES FOR GROUPS OF MEN HERE AT THIS STATIO?  1. I WOULD PREFER LESSONS SENT TO ME BY MAIL 2. I WOULD PREFER CLASSES FOR GROUPS OF MEN HERE 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER X. COL. 80 NOT USED. CARD 2

S0127.Q27. THE ARMY IS PLANNING TO SET UP A C.B.I. BRANCH OF THE ARMED FORCES INSTITUTE TO GIVE LESSONS BY MAIL TO THE MEN IN THIS THEATER. HAVING A BRANCH HERE IN THE THEATER WOULD MEAN THAT THE LESSONS AND INSTRUCTIONS COULD BE SENT TO THE MEN MUCH QUICKER THAN THEY COULD BE SENT FROM THE UNITED STATES. IF THIS C.B.I. BRANCH IS SET UP, DO YOU THINK YOU WOULD BE INTERESTED IN TAKING ANY COURSES OR STUDYING ANY SUBJECTS BY MAI?  1. NO, I WOULD NOT BE INTERESTED 2. I MIGHT BE INTERESTED 3. YES, I'M SURE I'D BE INTERESTED 4. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q28. IF YOU COULD DO WHAT YOU WANTED, WOULD YOU LIKE TO GO BACK TO SCHOOL OR COLLEGE AFTER THE WA?  1. YES, I WOULD LIKE TO GO BACK TO FULL-TIME SCHOOL AFTER THE WAR 2. YES, I WOULD LIKE TO GO BACK TO PART-TIME SCHOOL AFTER THE WAR 3. NO, I DON'T CARE TO GO BACK TO SCHOOL AFTER THE WAR 0. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q29. REGARDLESS OF WHAT YOU WANT TO DO, DO YOU THINK YOU WILL ACTUALLY GO BACK TO SCHOOL OR COLLEGE AFTER THE WA?  1. YES, I THINK I WILL GO TO FULL-TIME SCHOOL AFTER THE WAR 2. YES, I THINK I WILL GO TO PART-TIME SCHOOL AFTER THE WAR 3. NO, I DON'T THINK I WILL GO TO SCHOOL AFTER THE WAR 0. NO ANSWER
S0127.Q30A. "AFTER THE WAR THE UNITED STATES SHOULD CONTROL AND DOMINATE THE WORLD."  1. AGREE 2. DISAGREE 0. NO ANSWER
S0127.Q30B. "AFTER THE WAR THE UNITED STATES SHOULD STAY OUT OF WORLD AFFAIRS AND STICK TO THE PROBLEMS WE HAVE IN OUR OWN COUNTRY."  1. AGREE 2. DISAGREE 0. NO ANSWER
S0127.Q30C. "AFTER THE WAR THE NATIONS OF THE WORLD SHOULD SET UP A STRONG INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATION."  1. AGREE 2. DISAGREE 0. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q30D. "AFTER THE WAR THE UNITED STATES SHOULD JOIN A STRONG INTERNATIONAL ORGANIZATION OF NATIONS EVEN IF IT MEANT THAT THIS ORGANIZATION WOULD HAVE SOME CONTROL OVER HOW THE UNITED STATES DEALS WITH OTHER COUNTRIES."  1. AGREE 2. DISAGREE 0. NO ANSWER
S0127.Q30E. "AFTER THE WAR THERE SHOULD BE AN INTERNATIONALLY CONTROLLED ARMY TO POLICE THE WORLD."  1. AGREE 2. DISAGREE 0. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q31. WHICH DO YOU THINK WOULD BE THE BEST WAY FOR THE UNITED STATES TO KEEP OUT OF WAR IN THE FUTUR?  1. STAY OUT OF WORLD AFFAIRS 2. JOIN A STRONG ORGANIZATION OF NATIONS 3. ISOLATIONIST PLAN 4. IMPERIALIST PLAN 5. INTERNATIONALIST PLAN 6. UNCLASSIFIABLE OR NO PLAN 7. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q32. WHEN THE WAR IS OVER DO YOU THINK THE ARMY SHOULD RELEASE ALL SOLDIERS BACK TO CIVILIAN LIFE AS SOON AS POSSIBLE OR SHOULD IT RELEASE THEM ONLY WHEN THERE ARE JOBS FOR THE?  1. RELEASE MEN ONLY WHEN THERE ARE JOBS FOR THEM 2. RELEASE MEN AS SOON AS POSSIBLE WHETHER THERE ARE JOBS FOR THEM OR NOT 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER
S0127.V33G. MEN WITH DEPENDENTS:  1. ONE CHECK 2. TWO CHECKS 3. THREE CHECKS 4. NO CHECKS 5. INCONSISTENT ANSWERS 0. NO ANSWER TO ONE OR MORE
S0127.V33H. MEN WITH LONGEST SERVICE:  1. ONE CHECK 2. TWO CHECKS 3. THREE CHECKS 4. NO CHECKS 5. INCONSISTENT ANSWERS 0. NO ANSWER TO ONE OR MORE
S0127.V33I. MEN OVERSEAS LONGEST:  1. ONE CHECK 2. TWO CHECKS 3. THREE CHECKS 4. NO CHECKS 5. INCONSISTENT ANSWERS 0. NO ANSWER TO ONE OR MORE
S0127.V33J. MEN OVER THIRTY:  1. ONE CHECK 2. TWO CHECKS 3. THREE CHECKS 4. NO CHECKS 5. INCONSISTENT ANSWERS 0. NO ANSWER TO ONE OR MORE

S0127.Q34. DO YOU THINK THERE IS SOME OTHER GROUP OF SOLDIERS BESIDES THOSE LISTED IN QUESTION 33 THAT SHOULD BE LET OUT OF THE ARMY FIRS?  01. MEN WITH DEPENDENTS 02. MEN WHO HAVE BEEN IN THE ARMY LONGEST 03. MEN WHO HAVE SERVED OVERSEAS 04. MEN OVER THIRTY YEARS OF AGE 05. MEN WHO HAVE SERVED IN COMBAT 06. MEN WOUNDED OR PHYSICALLY OR PSYCHOLOGICALLY UNFIT 07. MEN WHO HAVE JOBS OR BUSINESSES WAITING 08. MEN PLANNING TO COMPLETE EDUCATION 09. ALL OTHER SUGGESTIONS 10. YES, CHECKED BUT NO GROUP SPECIFIED 11. NO, NO OTHER GROUP 00. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q35. AFTER THE WAR DO YOU THINK SOLDIERS SHOULD BE GIVEN FIRST CHOICE OF THE JOBS THAT ARE OPEN OR DO YOU THINK EVERYBODY SHOULD HAVE AN EQUAL CHANCE TO GET JOB?  1. SOLDIERS SHOULD GET FIRST CHOICE 2. EVERYBODY SHOULD HAVE AN EQUAL CHANCE 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q36. AFTER THE WAR, DO YOU THINK THE UNITED STATES COULD HAVE AN ARMY LARGE ENOUGH FOR THE COUNTRY'S NEEDS BY TAKING VOLUNTEERS ONL?  1. YES, I THINK IT COULD 2. NO, I DO NOT THINK IT COULD 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q37. AFTER THE WAR, DO YOU THINK THE UNITED STATES SHOULD DRAFT ALL YOUNG MEN FOR A CERTAIN AMOUNT OF ARMY TRAINING DURING PEACETIME OR SHOULD WE GO BACK TO THE REGULAR ARMY SYSTEM OF TAKING VOLUNTEERS ONL?  1. DRAFT ALL YOUNG MEN FOR A CERTAIN AMOUNT OF TRAINING 2. GO BACK TO TAKING VOLUNTEERS ONLY 3. UNDECIDED 0. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q38. WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING REASONS COMES CLOSEST TO SAYING WHY YOU THINK THE UNITED STATES SHOULD DRAFT ALL YOUNG MEN FOR A CERTAIN AMOUNT OF ARMY TRAINING DURING PEACETIM?  1. BECAUSE I THINK THE UNITED STATES SHOULD GO BACK TO TAKING VOLUNTEERS ONLY 2. BECAUSE I THINK THE ARMY EXPERIENCE IS WORTHWHILE FOR YOUNG MEN 3. BECAUSE I THINK IT IS NECESSARY FOR THE SAFETY OF THE UNITED STATES 4. BECAUSE I THINK IT IS BOTH WORTHWHILE FOR YOUNG MEN AND NECESSARY FOR THE SAFETY OF THE UNITED STATES 5. FOR SOME OTHER REASON 0. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q39. IF ALL YOUNG MEN IN THE UNITED STATES WERE TO BE GIVEN MILITARY TRAINING, AT ABOUT WHAT AGE DO YOU THINK THIS TRAINING SHOULD BEGI?  1. BEFORE 18 YEARS OF AGE 2. AT 18 YEARS OF AGE 3. AT 19 YEARS OF AGE 4. AT 20 YEARS OF AGE 5. AT 21 YEARS OF AGE 6. AFTER 21 YEARS OF AGE 0. NO ANSWER

S0127.Q40. IF ALL YOUNG MEN IN THE UNITED STATES WERE TO BE GIVEN MILITARY TRAINING, FOR ABOUT HOW LONG A TIME DO YOU THINK THIS TRAINING SHOULD LAS?  1. ABOUT 6 MONTHS 2. ABOUT 1 YEAR 3. ABOUT 1 1/2 YEARS 4. ABOUT 2 YEARS 5. MORE THAN 2 YEARS 0. NO ANSWER
